definitions.definition: A tendency to express warm , compassionate feelings .
examples: When the lovers were together, their cold indifference gave way to love and tenderness .

definitions.definition: A concern for the feelings or welfare of others.
examples: When they saw the poor orphans, they were overwhelmed with tenderness for them.
Everybody needs a little tenderness sometimes.

definitions.definition: A pain or discomfort when an affected area is touched .
examples: He noted her extreme tenderness when he touched the bruise on her thigh.

main_definition: A tendency to express warm , compassionate feelings .
secondary_definitions: A concern for the feelings or welfare of others.
( medicine , pathology ) A pain or discomfort when an affected area is touched .
